## GROUND LEASE

THIS LEASE, made by and between DUBLIN OAKS, an Ohio limited liability

company, asagent for and lessee of LUCAS-AVERY LIMITED, an Ohio limited liability company ("Lucas-Avery"), RICHARD J. SOLOVE, an unmarried individual ("Solove") and JOHN J. CHESTER, a married individual, whose spouse is Cynthia J. Chester, ("Chester"), Lucas-Avery, Solove and Chester being sometimes referred to hereafter collectively as "Owner" and said Dublin Oaks, an Ohio limited liability company, as such agent and lesseeof Owner being hereinafter called "Lessor", whose mailing address is c/o Don M. Casto Organization, 209 E. State Street, Columbus, Ohio 43215, and

TIM DONUT U.S. LIMITED, INC.

P. O. Box 256
4288 West Dublin-Granville Road
Dublin, Ohio 43017

a Florida corporation, hereinafter called "Lessee",

## WITNESSETH:

1. PREMISES:

In consideration of the rents, covenants and agreements hereinafter set forth, Lessor does hereby demise and lease to Lessee, and Lessee does hereby take and hire from Lessor, the Real Property situated in the City of Dublin, County of Franklin and State of Ohio, designated Outlot "B" and containing approximately 1.65 acres of land, and any and all improvements which now are or which shall be situated on said real property (the "Real Property") together with all rights, easements and appurtenances thereunto belonging or appertaining, (collectively referred to herein as the "Leased Premises"), a legal description of said Leased Premises is set forth in Exhibit A attached hereto and made a part hereof by reference.

2. TERM:

A. Original Term

The original term of this Lease shall be for a period commencing on the Commencement Date as defined in Section 3 below and ending on December 31 of the fifteenth (15th) full calendar year following such Commencement Date. The "Lease Year" shall be defined as each successive period of twelve (12) consecutive calendar months commencing on the first day of January of each year during the term hereof and ending on December 31 of each year of the term hereof. If the Commencement Date is other than January 1 of any calendar year, the period between the Commencement Date and December 31 of that year shall be the "First Partial Lease Year". Lessee's obligation to pay rent shall commence on the Commencement Date.

B. First Renewal Term

Upon the expiration of the original term of this Lease, this Lease shall

automatically renew for a period of five (5) Lease Years, except in the event Lessee gives Lessor a cancellation notice as hereinafter provided.

In the event Lessee elects to cancel the renewalterm of this Lease, such

cancellation notice may be given byLessee at any time but in any event must be given atleast one hundred eighty (180) days prior to theexpiration of the original term. In

BDOH04 Dublin - Tim's

the event Lessee exercises its option to cancel the renewal term of this Lease, this Lease shall terminate upon expiration of the then ending term.

Except in the event thatLessee cancels therenewal term of this Lease, this Lease shall be renewed at the rental set forth in Section 4 hereof, and upon the same other terms and conditions as are applicable to the original term, except that the renewal shall begin on thedate immediately following the date of expiration of the original term and shall continue for a period of five (5) Lease years thereafter.

## C. Second and Subsequent Renewal Terms

In the event Lessee does not cancel the first renewal term of this Lease and this Lease shall renew forthe first renewal term as provided herein, this Lease shall renew for two (2) additional periods of five (5) LeaseYears each at therental as set forth in Section 4 hereof and upon the same other terms and conditions as are applicable to the first renewal term except that such subsequent renewal terms shall begin on the date immediately following the date of expiration of the previous renewal term and shall continue for aperiod of five (5) Lease Years thereafter. Said renewals for additional terms shall be subject to the same notice provisions and the same provisions regarding the cancellation of the renewal by Lessee as the first renewal term, except that any such cancellation notice may be given by Lessee at any time, but in any event must be given at least one hundred eighty (180) days prior to the expiration of the first renewal term or the second renewal term, as the case may be.

## D. Termination

Lessee may terminate this Lease by notice given at any time following the last day of the tenth (10th) and before the first day of the twelfth (12th) LeaseYear of the original term, but not prior toor after such time, by giving Lessor at least ninety (90) days' notice provided that gross sales (as defined herein) are less than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000.00) in the ninth (9th) or any successive Lease Year, and paying at termination the sum of Forty-Six Thousand and No/100 Dollars ($46,000.00) as consideration for such termination. The aforesaid termination consideration shall be due thirty (30) days after Tenant's exercise of the termination right and shallbe in addition to all sums ordinarily due under theLease for periods through the termination effective date.

## 3. COMMENCEMENT DATE:

The "Commencement Date" of this Lease shall be the earlier of the following: (a) The date of the opening to the public of Lessee's business on the Real Property, or (b) theday immediatelyfollowing thedateas of whichall of thefollowing have occurred: (i) one hundred fifty (150) days shall have passed since the later of the date Lessee shall have obtained all permits, licenses, variances and approvals referred to in Subsection B of Section 8 below, all of which Lessee shall apply for by not later than the 45th day after the date of full execution hereof and which Lessee shall diligently pursue, or the date on which Lessor approves Lessee's Plans in accordance with Subsection Aof Section 8, below; (ii) the Memorandum of Lease referred to in Section34 below has been executed by Lessor and delivered to Lessee; (iii) all title matters pursuant to Section 16 below have been satisfied by Lessor or waived in writing or by the passage of any notice deadline date, by Lessee; (iv) Lessor has obtained and delivered to Lessee such fully executed estoppel certificates and non- disturbance and attornment agreements as are required to be delivered to Lessee; and (v) theconditions set forth in Subsections C, DandE ofSection 8 below have been satisfied or waived by Lessee; provided, however, that said one hundred fifty (150) day period shall beextended by the amount of time attributable to any delays due to causesbeyond Lessee's control, including but notlimited to acts of God, strikes, lockouts or unavailability of materials. Notwithstanding the foregoing or anything to

BDOH04 Dublin - Tim's 2



the contrary contained herein, in no event will Lessee be required to open for business and the Commencement Date shall not occur prior to the date on which the Kroger Supermarket initially opens for business to the public in the Shopping Center. Upon the execution of this Lease, Lessee shall have the right to enter upon the Leased Premises for the limited purpose of surveying the Leased Premises and conducting such soil tests as Lessee deems necessary, in compliance with the terms and provisions of Section 8 herein. Notwithstanding anything contained in the foregoing, upon satisfaction of the Commencement Date contingencies referred to in Section 3(b), Lessee shall have possession of the Leased Premises.

The "Effective Date" of this Lease shall be considered to be the date of full execution hereof. The date of full execution hereof shall be deemed to be the last date on which this Lease has been signed by a party hereto and all changes to the printed form of this Lease shall have been initialed by the parties.

4. RENTAL:

A. Fixed Annual Rental

Lessee shall pay to Lessor, at Lessor's address shown above, or at such other address as Lessor may from time to time designate in writing, a fixed annual rental (the "Fixed Annual Rental") in accordance with the "Rental Schedule" set forth below, payable in equal consecutive monthly installments of one-twelfth (1/12) of said Fixed Annual Rental. Each such monthly installment shall be due and payable in advance without offset or counterclaim on the first day of each calendar month during the original term of this Lease and any renewal term. If the Commencement Date does not fall on the first day of a calendar month, then the first payment shall be for only the portion of the first month attributable to the term of the Lease prorated on a daily basis; the monthly rental for the remainder of the First Partial Lease Year shall be Six Thousand Six Hundred Sixty-Six and 67/100 Dollars ($6,666.67).

B. Rental Schedule

| Lease Years              | Fixed Annual Rent   |
|-|-|
| 1-5                      | $ 80,000.00         |
| 6-10                     | 92,000.00           |
| 11-15                    | 105,800.00          |
| 16-20 (1 renewal term)   | 121,670.00          |
| 21-25 (2nd renewal term) | 139,920.50          |
| 26-30 (3rd renewal term) | 160,908.58          |

Notwithstanding any contrary provision of this Lease, in no event shall Lessee be required to pay any Rent required under this Lease to more than one individual person or entity comprising Lessor (or Owner) hereunder. At all such times as Lessor (or Owner) consists of multiple persons or entities, one of them shall be appointed as agent to receive all Rent due under this Lease. As of the Commencement Date, Lessor's and Owner's agent for the purposes herein shall be Dublin Oaks.

## C. Co-Tenancy

Lessee's obligation to pay the incremental Fixed Annual Rental as set forth in the Rental Schedule in excess of the initial Eighty Thousand and No/100 Dollars ($80,000.00) (which sum shall in any event be due) for Lease Years 6-10 and thereafter shall be conditioned upon at least sixty-five percent (65%) of the gross leaseable area of the "Shopping Center" located on Lessor's Larger Tract (as hereinafter defined) (hereinafter "minimum occupancy level") which is available for lease from time to time (excluding the Real Property) being leased to and occupied by

BDOH04 Dublin - Tim's

3

retail tenants who are open andoperating, and provided that included amongthat space will be at least one (1) national or regional anchor tenant suchas Kroger's or Drug Emporium. The total gross leaseable area for the Shopping Center currently is one hundred sixty-nine thousand(166,205) square feet, excluding areas marked on Exhibit B as "Future (N.I.C.) Anchor A", but only until built and ready for leasing as set forth herein. Lessor shall provide to Lessee, at Lessee's request (but not more than annually), awritten statementdisclosing the then current total gross leaseable area and occupancy level of the Shopping Center.

If at any time the minimum occupancy level of the Shopping Center is not met for a period of one hundred eighty (180) consecutivedays, for any reason other than force majeure, Lessee from said one hundred eightieth (180t) day and monthly thereafter forso longas the minimum occupancy level is not met shall pay, in lieu of the Fixed Annual Rental set forth herein, a monthly rental equal to the lesser of(i) three percent (3%) of gross sales for such months in all subsequent Lease Years, or (ii) one-twelfth (1/12th) of the Fixed Annual Rental which would otherwise then be in effect. Such monthly rent shall be due and payable within thirty (30) days following the month for which it is due.

If the minimum occupancy level of the Shopping Center is not restored within twelve (12) months, then Lessee shall have the right to terminate this Lease provided that Lessee's gross sales during said twelve (12) month period have declined by more than five percent (5%) over the same twelve (12) month period in the previous calendar year. Lessee shall notify Lessor, in writing, of its election to terminate within thirty (30) days after Lessor's twelve (12) month cure period. If Lessee does not terminate as provided herein then at the expirationof thecureperiod FixedAnnual Rent shall be fully reinstated.

## 5. TAXES AND ASSESSMENTS;

Lessor shall pay all real estate taxes, including penalties and interest, for tax years preceding the Commencement Date of this lease. Lessor shallalso pay all special assessments which are a lien on the Real Property on the Commencement Date of this lease, whether or not such assessments are past due, then due or are thereafter to become due and any assessments or charges which are for improvements then installed.

Lessee agrees to pay to or reimburse Lessor for its payment to (whichever Lessor may elect) the appropriate governmental agencies all other real property taxes, assessments, impositions, or all other claims or charges (herein collectively called the "taxes") which may constitute or may be reduced to a lien upon the Real Property, including but not limited to water charges and sewer charges, before thesame shall become delinquent. Any reimbursement due Lessor under this paragraph shall be paidby Lessee within thirty (30)daysofLessor's invoice accompanied by a copy of thetax billing in question. All such payments for the first and last year of the original term or any renewal terms shall be prorated between Lessor and Lessee so that Lessee shall be responsible for that portion of the taxes which is attributable to the original term and any renewal term. Lessee's tax obligationshall commence on the Commencement Date hereof. Inthe eventthere is included in the taxes any special assessment or assessment which may be paid in installments, unless otherwise directed by written notice from Lessee, Lessor shall advise the appropriate governmental agency of its intention to elect payments in installments thereof, and Lessee shall pay such installments as shall be due and payable during the original term or any renewal term, regardless of when such installment was assessed, plus any carrying chargesorinterest assessed by the authorities for the privilege of paying over time.

In the event the Real Property is a portion of a larger tax parcel, Lessor agrees to use its best efforts to have the Real Property designated as a separate parcel

BDOH04 Dublin - Tim's

4

for taxing purposes so that the assessed valuation of the land and buildings shallrelate only to the land constituting theReal Property and to the buildings and improvements constructed on the Real Property.

In the event the Real Property is a portion of a larger tax parcel and the Lessor is unable to have the Real Property designated as a separate parcel for taxing purposes, sothat taxes are assessed upon the larger tax parcel of which the Real Property is a portion, Lessee agrees to pay that portion of the taxes which is reasonably attributable tothe Real Property, determined as follows:

In the event the taxes are identified or apportioned by the taxing authorities or are identifiable or apportionable based on valuation or other information furnished by the taxing authority so that the portion of the taxes attributable to the value of the land can be distinguished from the portion of the taxes attributable to the value of the buildings, then as to that portion of the taxes attributable to the value of the land, Lessee will pay a percentage of such portion of the taxes determined by dividing the area of the Real Property by the total area of the assessed parcel, and as to the portion of the taxes attributable to the value of the buildings, Lessee will pay a percentage of such portion of the taxes determined by dividing the gross floor area of the building on the Real Property by the gross floor area of all buildings located on the assessed parcel.

Lessor will notify Lessee in writing of any taxes which Lessee is required to pay or reimburse in accordance with the provisions of this Section. Except where Lessor has determined to advance pay such taxes and then seek reimbursement from Lessor such notification shall be furnished to Lessee not less than twenty (20) days before the date such taxes are due and shall be accompanied by a copy of the tax bill. Any taxes which Lessee is required to pay or reimburse shall be paid by it, through Lessor, no later than the date on which such taxes are due unless the notification by Lessor is received by Lessee less than twenty (20) days before the date on which such taxes are due or after Lessor has advance paid such taxes, in which event Lessee shall pay to or reimburse to Lessor such taxes within twenty (20) days after the date of such notification, and Lessor shall be responsible for the payment of any penalties, interest or other charges imposed upon delinquent payment of taxes. In the event the Real Property is a portion of a larger tax parcel, then the written notification by Lessor to Lessee of such taxes shall set forth (1) the total taxes on the larger tax parcel accompanied by a copy of the tax bill; (2) whether the total taxes on the larger tax parcel are identifiable or apportionable between land and buildings and if so, the amount of taxes attributable to the land and the amount of taxes attributable to buildings; and (3) Lessee's portion of the total taxes together with a statement showing how Lessee's portion was calculated in accordance with this Section.

If Lessee fails to pay or reimburse to Lessor any taxes which it is required to pay within the time period provided above, Lessor may, atits option, if applicable, pay said taxes, together with any and all penalties and said amount shall in any event become immediately due and payable as additional rent with interest at eighteen percent (18%) until paid.

Lessee shall have the right in its own name, or in Lessor's name where appropriate, but at its own cost and expense, to contest the amount or legality of any taxes which it is obligated to pay hereunder and make application for the reduction thereof, or any assessment upon which the same may be based, and the Lessor agrees, at the request and expense of Lessee, to execute or join in the execution of any instruments or documents necessary in connection with such contest or application. If Lessee shall contest such tax assessment, or other imposition, the time within which

BDOH04 Dublin - Tim's

5

Lessee shall be required to pay the same shall be extended until such contest or application shall have been finally determined, except that Lessee shall be responsible for any penalty imposed by the taxing authority resulting from the late payment of taxes due to said contest. Lessee shall escrow the amount of the taxes being contested in accordance with State law in order to prevent the lien for taxes being regarded as delinquent and shall pursue such proceedings only in a manner which will not allow the authorities to file for tax foreclosure.

In no event shall either party be liable for payment of any income, estate or inheritance taxes imposed upon the other party or the estate of the other party. Neither partyshall be obligated to pay any income, franchise, excise, sales or excess profits tax levied upon, required to be collected by, or assessed against the other party.

## 6. INSURANCE:

Lessee hereby covenants and agrees at all times during the original term of this Lease and any renewal term to maintain and keep in force comprehensive general liability insurance against all claims for personal injury, death, or property damage occurring on the Leased Premises with minimum limits of liability of One Million Dollars ($1,000,000.00) per person, One Million Dollars ($1,000,000.00) per occurrence and Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000.00) property damage together with at least $10,000,000.00 "umbrella" liability coverage. Lessee shall furnish certificates of insurance evidencing payment thereof to Lessor as the same shall be requested in writing from time to time by Lessor. All such insurance policies may be maintained under a "blanket insurance policy" of Lessee.

From and after the commencement of construction of its initial improvements on the Real Property and thereafter through the end of the Lease term (as may be extended), the Lessee shall defend, protect, indemnify, and save harmless the Lessor and the Real Property from and against any and all claims, losses, damages, liability, expenses (including legal), or fines arising out of any act, failure to act, or negligence of the Lessee, Lessee's agents, servants, or employees, in, on, or about the Real Property, or arising with respect to or out of any occurrences on the Real Property, or arising out of any breach by Lessee of any of the terms and conditions of this Lease, or out of any failure of the Real Property to comply with applicable codes and laws, except for any Lessor responsibilities under Paragraph 37. Lessee shall, at all times and at its own cost, protect the Lessor with comprehensive general liability insurance in the amounts provided in this Paragraph 6. Lessee shall deliver certificates of such insurance to Lessor prior to the date of commencement of construction by Lessee of its initial improvements, and said policy or policies shall protect Lessee, Lessor and, if any, Lessor's first Mortgagee, as their interests may appear, throughout the term of this Lease and any extension hereof. Should Lessee fail to carry such public liability insurance, Lessor may, after thirty (30) days written notice to Lessee, at its option, but shall not be required cause such public liability insurance to be issued and, in such event, Lessee agrees to pay the premium for such insurance promptly upon Lessor's demand. Such liability insurance policy or policies shall bear endorsements to the effect that the insurer agrees to notify Lessor not less than ten (10) days in advance of any modification or cancellation thereof. Every five (5) years from the Lease commencement date, Lessor and Lessee shall, at the option of either of them, review the above coverage amounts, and shall, if applicable, increase such coverage amounts so as to provide a comparable dollar value of coverage, adjusted for inflation, to that insurance required hereunder as of the Commencement Date. Lessee shall also carry workers compensation insurance as required by Ohio law, and any injuries to employees of Lessee in and about the Real Property and the Shopping Center or while going to or coming from said places shall be dealt with strictly as a matter between Lessee, the employee, and the State of Ohio, and Lessee shall indemnify, defend and hold Lessor harmless from any involvement therein and any loss, cost, liability,

BDOH04 Dublin - Tim's

6

attorneys fees, judgments, suits,damages and the like of any kind or nature arising therefrom.

Lessee shall, at Lessee's expense, keep all of the improvements on the Real Property insured against fire, with extended coverage and with coverage against such other perilsas are commonly included in an "all risk" policy in an amount not less than thefull replacement cost of the improvements. Such insurance shall be issuedby a company or companies qualified to do business in the State of Ohio with a Best's Insurance Guide rating of A:XII or better. Such policy or policies shall bear endorsements to the effect that the insurer agrees to notify Lessor not less than ten (10) days in advance of any modification or cancellation thereof. Lessor shall be furnished certificates from the insuring company showing the existence ofsuch insurance and showing the premiums thereof to be paid.

## 7. UTILITIES:

Lessee shall pay any "tap in" fees or other charges for the installation or connection of oil, gas, electricity, water, telephone, sanitary sewer, storm or drainage sewer or ditch, and any and all other utilities (hereinafter collectively referred to as "Utilities") for the Real Property and shall pay as andwhen due all charges made against the premises for Utilities.

Notwithstanding the preceding paragraph, if the Utilities are not available to the boundaries of theReal Property, or within easements or rights-of-way abutting the Real Property, then within thirty (30) days after written request byLessee, Lessor shall so extend such Utilities to a location as aforesaid at which Lessee can tap into and receive service. Lessor shall bear all costs incurred in so extending the Utilities. Lessor shall also use its best efforts and cooperate with Lessee to obtain all easements necessary to permit the use and maintenance byLesseeof all required Utilities.

## 8. CONSTRUCTION OF IMPROVEMENTS:

## A. Plans and Specifications

Lessor acknowledges that it has seen and is familiar with the type of building constructed by Lessee, and Lessee is not required to submit to Lessor or to any third party (excluding any governmental authority or agency) detailed plans and specifications for the building and other improvements which Lessee desires to construct onthe Leased Premises. However, Lessee shall be required to submit a site plan, renderings and elevations clearly conveying the appearance the building shall have, and a landscaping plan (collectively the "Plans") to be approved by Lessor, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. If Lessor shall fail to advise Lessee thatthe Plans submitted to Lessor are approved or disapproved within fifteen (15) days after Lessor's receipt of such Plans, Lessor shall be deemed to have approved the Plans as submitted. If Lessor shall disapprove the Plans, Lessor shall give Lessee written notice of such disapproval within said fifteen(15) day period, which notice shall specifically set forth Lessor's objections. Thereupon, Lesseeshall have fourteen (14) days to revise the Plans and respond to Lessor's objections. If Lessor fails to object to the revised Plans, in writing, within said fourteen (14) day period, Lessor shall be deemed to have approved the revised Plans as submitted. The approval by Lessor of the Plans shall not constitute an opinion or representation by Lessor asto the sufficiency of the Plans nor impose any present or future liability or responsibility upon Lessor. In the event Lessor approves the Plans, Lessee agrees to construct the building and improvements upon the Leased Premises in substantial accordance with such Plans. Any disapprovals of the Plans by Lessor shall be exercised in good faith.

BDOH04 Dublin - Tim's 7

7

## B. Zoning, Licenses and Permits

Lessor represents and warrantsthatthe use of the Leased Premises for a restaurant with pick-up windows is a permitted use under the zoning classification and local laws and ordinances applicable to the Leased Premises, that Lessee will be permitted withoutdelayand upon payment of applicable customary and normal fees to tap into and receive service from all Utilities without the imposition of charges other than charges of the type and amount which are customarily and normally charged in the locality in which the Leased Premises are located, and that Lessor has no knowledge of anything thatwould prohibit Lessee from obtaining all licenses and permits, including, but not limited to, those pertaining to building and occupancy, which are necessary to Lessee's business.

Lessor acknowledges that this Lease is contingent upon Lessee's obtaining all necessary permits, licenses, variances (including, without limitation, parking variances) and approvals pertaining to the building, occupancy, signs (including, without limitation, the installation and maintenance of Lessee's standard building signage upon the Leased Premises, subject to the provisions of Section 22 herein), driveways (including ingress and egressto public thoroughfares by means of access through Lessor's Shopping Center), rather than by direct curb cutonto said thoroughfares, it being agreed and understood that Lessee shall not pursue or install any such direct access curb cuts without Lessor's prior consent, zoning, environmental controls, and any other governmental permits (collectively, the "Permits") which, in the reasonable judgment of Lessee, are necessary to permit it to construct and operate a Tim Hortons and/or Wendy's restaurant with pick-up windows upon the Leased Premises. The obligations of Lessee hereunder shall beconditioned upon all of said Permits being validly and irrevocably granted on terms and conditions and ata cost reasonably satisfactory to Lessee without qualification, except such qualification as shall be acceptable to Lessee, and no longer subject to appeal. Lessor agrees to execute any applications or other documents requested by Lessee in order to obtain any Permits. In the event any of theaforesaid Permits have not been obtained within one hundred twenty (120) days following the Effective Date of this Lease (said 120 day period ishereinafter referred to as the "Contingency Period"), then by written notice given to Lessor, Lessee may terminate this Lease and both parties shallberelieved from any obligations and/or liabilities hereunder, and all deposits and payments made hereunder by Lessee shall be refunded to Lessee. Lessee shall at all times act with diligence in its pursuit of the Permits.

Lessor may terminate this Lease if Lessee has not obtained all Permits within one (1) year of the Effective Date.

## C. Environmental Audit and Testing.

Lessee, at its expense, may obtain a Phase I Environmental Audit of the Leased Premises and any other environmental testing which Lessee deems reasonably necessary to evaluate potential environmental risks. If such audit or tests reveal the existence of any toxic or hazardous waste, material or substance on or under the Leased Premises or any other environmental condition which would adversely affect Lessee's ability to finance, use and/or develop the Leased Premises, then Lessee may terminate this Lease by written notice to Lessor given within the Contingency Period. Lessor shall complete the Environmental Disclosure and Risk Review Questionnaire attached hereto as Exhibit C to the best of Lessor's knowledge and only to the extent no outside costs to Lessor are involved, and return the completed Questionnaire to Lessee within thirty (30) days after the Effective Date of the Lease. In the event Lessee does not receive a fully-completed Questionnaire, to the best of Lessor's knowledge and only to the extent no outside costs to Lessor are involved, Lessee may terminate this Lease by written notice to Lessor given within the Contingency Period.

BDOH04 Dublin - Tim's

8

## D. Survey and Soil Tests

Within thirty (30) days following the Effective Date of this Lease, Lessee, at its expense, may order a current certified survey of the Leased Premises, bearing a legal description of the Leased Premises, madeand prepared by a reputable and competent licensed surveyor showing: (i) the area, dimension and locations of the Real Property to the nearest monuments, streets and alleys on all sides; (ii) spot elevations and bench marks; (iii) the location of all available utilities in adjoining streets, alleys or properties with invert elevations of basins, manholes, etc.; (iv) the location and description of all existing and/or proposed easements against or appurtenant to the Leased Premises; and (v) the location of all improvements and encroachments. In addition to the foregoing, if deemed necessary by Lessee, Lessee, at Lessee's expense, shall order a plan of subdivision for theLeased Premises made and prepared by a reputable and competent licensed surveyor in the jurisdiction in which the Leased Premises are located, showing the Real Property and any and all easements set forth in this Lease.

At Lessee's expense, Lessee may obtain borings, soil bearing tests, tests for toxic or hazardous substances and other tests (collectively the "Soils Tests") to determine the suitability of the Leased Premises for building foundations and the construction, operation and financing of the improvements which Lessee may wish to make, provided, however, that said Soils Tests shall be so conducted as notto damage the Leased Premises.

If the survey, borings and/or Soils Tests disclose any condition which, in Lessee's judgment, would render the Leased Premises unusable by Lessee for the construction and operation of a Tim Hortons and/or Wendy's restaurant with pick-up windows, then Lessee may terminate this Leaseby written notice to Lessor given within the Contingency Period.

## E. {Intentionally Deleted}

## F. Indemnification

Lessee shall indemnify, defend, protect, keep, save and hold Lessor harmless from any and all loss, costs, damages, claims, liability, suits, judgments, expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees), penalties and fines of any kind or nature whatsoever which may be incurredby Lessor or claimed, brought, pursuedor obtained against Lessor by any person or persons, for any injuries,expense or damages to persons or property of whatever kind or character consequent or arising directly or indirectly from the entry by Lessee or its agents upon the Leased Premises to conduct or perform audits, surveys, Soils Tests and such other inspections, investigations or tests as permitted in this Section 8,except as may be caused by the negligent or intentional acts of Lessor.

## 9. ALTERATIONS:

During the original term or any renewal term of this Lease, Lessee shall not make alterations, additions and improvements to the exterior of its buildingor other permanent improvements on the Leased Premises without the consent of Lessor, however Lessee shall have the right to erect and install such other or additional improvements, and equipment to the interior of its building on the Leased Premises as Lessee may, in its sole judgment, deem desirable for conducting its businessthereon.

## 10. CASUALTY LOSS:

If the building or other improvements located on the Leased Premises should be damaged by fire or other casualty so that the business conducted on the Leased Premises could not be conducted in a normal manner until the building and/or improvements are repaired or reconstructed, then Lessee shall repair or reconstruct the buildings and/or improvements, except that in the event that at the time of the casualty the Lease term or renewal term shall have less than five (5) years to run Lessee may cancel this Lease by written notice given within ninety (90) days after the date of the fire or other casualty in which case Lessee shall return possession of the Leased Premises to Lessor with all buildings removed from the surfaceof the Leased Premises and the same left in a safe and sightly condition.In the event Lessee is required or elects to repair or reconstruct the buildings and/or improvements, this Lease shall continue in force and effect and the rent payable under Section 4 hereof shall not abate.

If the building or other improvements located on the Leased Premises should be damaged by fire or other casualty but the damage is sufficiently limited that in the reasonable judgment of Lessee the business conducted on the Leased Premises can continue to be conducted in a normal manner while the buildings and improvements are being repaired, then Lessee shall repair the buildings and/or improvements and this Lease shall continue in force and effect and rent shall not abate.

## Memorandum

Date: October 18, 1995

+ REVISED November 13, 1995

++REVISED July 21, 1997

To: Outparcel Tenants

From: Mark Ford, Ford Beery Architects, Inc.

Re: Avery Road Retail, Dublin, Ohio

Below isan outline of the outparcel restrictions for the above referenced retail development. These items shall be applied to each outlot in Subarea B-1, as defined in the Development Standards approved by the City of Dublin, March 6, 1989 and as illustrated on the preliminary plat prepared by Evans, Mechwart, Hambleton & Tilton, Inc. dated October 16, 1995. Should the City of Dublin modify the requirements for the retail center, the outlot tenants will be required to comply with the revised requirements.

The restrictions are as follows:

## GENERAL REQUIREMENTS

	1. Setbacks:

	++ a. The setback from Avery Road shall be 45' for pavement and 65 for buildings.

		b. The setback from Perimeter Loop Drive (South Access Road) will be 25' for pavement and 50' for buildings.

		c. The setback from Perimeter Drive Extension shall be 30' for pavement and 50' for buildings.

		d. Side yards shall be 25' for pavement and buildings.

++ e. Rear yards shall be 10' for pavement and buildings.

		f. Front yard parking setback from publicly dedicated localaccess streets shall be 25' for pavement and 50' for buildings.

		g. Tenant shall comply with the 150' no-build visibility corridor as indicated on the Landlord's site plan.

2. The total ground covered by all buildings shall not exceed 25% of the total lot area.

3. Parking andloading spaces shall be provided in the size, ratio and type as regulated in the Dublin Zoning Code Chapter 1193.

		a. Drive-thru stacking areas for fast food restaurants shall accommodate a minimum of eight spaces per exchange window.

		b. Bank drive-thru stacking requirements as per the Columbus Zoning Code.

		C. Parking stalls shall be laid out in the most efficient manner; 90 degree layouts are suggested with 9' x 19' stalls and 22' to 24' aisles.

d. One curb cut shall be permitted for each outparcel, subject to approval by the City of Dublin.

## 4. Landscaping:

	a. All landscaping shall be regulated by the Dublin Landscape Code Chapter 1187.

	b. Any portion of a lot upon which a building or parking area is not constructed shall be landscaped.

	c. Landscaping along the Avery Road frontage shall be in compliance with the Avery Road corridor master plan and as installed during the retail center construction.

	d. Along both Perimeter Drive Extension and Perimeter Loop Drive (South Access Road), a threeto four foot high landscape mound shall be provided with street trees planted at 50' on center, within the right of way and planted one foot from the right-of -way. Final screening plans for Perimeter Drive Extension and Perimeter Drive Loop shall be subject to approval by Landlord. In the event the Landlord is required to construct mounding and screening prior to outlot tenant construction, outlot tenant shall reimburse Landlord for such work.

	e. Minimum size of all trees shall be 2" to 2-1/2" caliper for shade trees, 6' to 8' for evergreen trees, and I" to 1-1/2" for ornamental trees.

	f. A three foot high mound is required along the west access drive toscreen the outlot parking areas from the service drive.

	g. Shrub plants are recommended massed or clustered in beds rather than singular shrub plantings.

5. Site Lighting:

	a. External lighting within each outlot shall be cutoff type fixtures.

	b. All parking,pedestrian and other exterior lighting shall be on poles or wall mounted cutoff fixtures and shall be from the same type and style as those used in the retail center.

	c. All light poles and standards shall be dark in color and shall be constructed of dark brown, black or bronze metal.

	d. Parking lot lighting shall not be higher than 28'.

	e. Cut off landscape and building uplighting shall be permitted.

6. Waste and Refuse:

	a. All waste and refuse shall be containerized and fully screened from view by a solid wail or fence.

7. Storage and Equipment:

	a. No materials, supplies, equipment or products shall be stored or permitted toremain on any portion of a parcel outside a permitted structure.

	b. Mechanical equipment or other utility hardware on the roof, ground or buildings shall be screened from public view with materials harmonious with the building.

## ARCHITECTURAL REQUIREMENTS

1. Each outparcel structure shall be designed to be compatible with the architectural character of the retail center by employing similar roof pitches, architectural details and be constructed of the same exterior building materials as the retail center. Exterior materials may be either brick or stone or combination of the two.

2. No outlot shall be oriented towards Avery Road.

3. The building shall have the same degree finish on all four sides.

## 5. Ground signs:

a. All uses withinSubarea B-1 shall beallowed two (2) ground signs; one sign orientedtoward Avery Road and one sign oriented toward the access road on the west side of the outlots.

b. Ground signs shall have a maximum height of 6' and contain no more than 50 SF of area per face.

c. All ground supported signage shall reflect a uniform shape and shall be set in a frame of dark brown, black or bronze color.

d. Tenant identification shall be:

1. Internally illuminated individually mounted letters with letter faces of 3/16 inch Plexiglass. Returns and caps shall be .040 charcoal gray colored aluminum. Should the Cityof Dublin modify therequirements for the retail center, the outlot tenants will be required to comply with the revised requirements.

e. All ground signs are to be constructed with a stone and brick base that is consistent in color with the stone used in the retail center. A maximum of three (3) finish materials shall be used.

g. All ground signs shall have a minimum landscaped area of one hundred square feet (100 SF) if not placed in an already landscaped area. Landscaping shall be complementary to the signage and may include evergreen shrubs, flowers, mulch, and/or seasonal ground covers.

h. Each outlot building site shall provide appropriate directional signage at ingress/egress access points. On site permanent directional signs, e.g. employee and visitor parking, deliveries, etc. will be of a common design, material and size. Maximum height of directional signage shall be three feet (3') and the maximum copy area type face shall be four square feet (4 SF).

i. Tenant ground signs may be externally illuminated. Light sources to illuminate signs shall be shielded from all adjacent residential buildings and streets and shall not be of such brightness so as to cause glare hazardous to pedestrians and motorists.

6. Building Signs:

a. No building mounted signs will be allowed along the Avery Road frontage.

7. Prohibited Signage:

a. No signs shall be painted or posted directly on the surface of any building, wall or fence. No wall murals shall be allowed.

b. No signs shall be applied to windows for the purpose of outdoor or exterior advertising.

c. No roof signs shall be permitted. Nor should a sign extend higher than the building.

d. No flashing, traveling, animated or intermittently illuminated sings may be used.

e. No billboards, or electrical or other advertising signs shall be allowed other than a signcarrying the name of the business occupying the site.
